p: Maianthemum racemosum was uncommon at both sites in both years. In total, we found and measured 50 M. racemosum in 2012 and 24 in 2016, of which 12 (24 %) and 5 (21 %) were in open plots in 2012 and 2016, respectively. Stem height (Est ± 1SE: −0.74 ± 0.14, t=−5.2, χ 2=7.1, df = 1, P = 0.01) and leaf width (Est ± 1SE: −0.27 ± 0.06, t=4.33, χ 2=6.4, df = 1, P = 0.01) were significantly higher in fenced (mean ± 1SE; height: 23.69 ± 1.8 cm; leaf width: 3.96 ± 0.14 cm) than open plots (height: 10.4 ± 1.1 cm; leaf width: 3.11 ± 0.23 cm; Fig. 10). We found no flowering M. racemosum in open plots at either site, but 32 % and 16 % of plants flowered in fenced plots at sites 5 and 8, respectively. Flowering plants were significantly taller (Est ± 1SE: 0.75 ± 0.15, t=5.1, χ 2=21.9, df = 1, P < 0.001) than non-flowering plants at both sites.
